With the simulated climate data, the predictions for variables of interest in steps (I) and (II) from the prior models are recalculated to have new estimates for the caloric deficit as well as the food vulnerability. In this way the methodology allows for the mapping of current food situation and vulnerability to undernourishment, versus the scenario with climate change. Additionally, it allows us to contrast the impact of climate change with the structural conditions that determine vulnerability to undernourishment.
